question.text: List the set of factors from the following, which are responsible for dissociation of oxygen from the oxyhaemoglobin?

options.text: High pCO<sub>2</sub>, low pO<sub>2</sub>, low pH
High temperature, low pO<sub>2</sub>, less H<sup>+</sup> conc.
Low pO<sub>2</sub>, high pCO<sub>2</sub>, high pH
High pO<sub>2</sub>, low pCO<sub>2</sub>, high temperature

solution.text: At the level of tissues, low pO2, high pCO2, high H+ concentration or low pH and high temperature are all favourable conditions for shifting the oxygen-haemoglobin dissociation curve towards right side by decreasing oxygen affinity and therefore causes dissociation of oxygen from the oxyhaemoglobin.
